trait.name: Caramel Breath
entries: Karamell can exhale a sticky, caramel-like substance in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained until the end of their next turn as they become coated in the caramel. Creatures can use their action to make a DC 12 Strength check, freeing themselves or another creature within reach on a success.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}Damage (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Karamell is a small dragon, not much larger than a house cat, with scales that shimmer in hues of deep gold and brown, reminiscent of flowing caramel. Despite its diminutive size, Karamell is fiercely protective and surprisingly playful.

Karamell was born under unusual circumstances. A wizard specializing in culinary magic attempted to create the ultimate dessert and accidentally infused a dragon egg with magical caramel. The result was Karamell, a unique dragon with abilities related to caramel. Despite its origins, Karamell quickly became more than just a magical experiment, forming a deep bond with the wizard who raised it as a pet and guardian.
